result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony P Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and school. Credit for 2 days.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments and supervision fees not to exceed $500.00 per Court order. To be paid out of bail on deposit if any with the balance due prior to the end of the Probationary period. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.

NO new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding;
NO possession of any firearms/body armor/weapons/ammunition during the pendency of this case.
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes all conditions of Probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony P Williams

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D325
cf
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes all conditions of Probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
Received and filed with the court.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and school.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 M0NTHS with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, and supervision fees to to exceed $500.00, per court order, to be paid out of bail on deposit, if any; with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  25 hours of community service.
*  Defendant shall not be in possession of any firearms/body armor/weapons/ammunition during the pendency of this case.

Court WILL consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

At the hour of 10:25 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY of Carry Concealed Weapon, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Parties are prepared to go forward with Sentencing.

Defendant Anthony P Williams in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alicia H. Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in box at 09:19 am.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 09:22 am. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Chad Olszewski who was duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Anthony P Williams in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Alicia H. Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  11:14 am.  
Court adjourned the trial for lunch. Court instruct the panel. Court ordered the panel back at 01:30 pm. Panel out at 12:00 pm.  Discussions held outside the presence of the Panel.  Panel in at 01:38 pm.
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn at 02:07 pm.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by the State.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  1).  Officer Jeremy A Carter (MPD).  Direct Examination.  Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 marked, offered, and received into evidence. Cross-Examination. Redirect. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 02:45 pm.  Discussions held outside the presence of the jury.  Defense moves for dismissal argued and denied by the Court.  Jury in box at 03:04 pm.  Opening statements made by Defense.  Sworn for Defense: 1). Defendant Anthony P Williams. Direct Examination. Cross-Examination. Redirect.  Defense rests.  Sworn for State as rebuttal witness: 1). Officer Jeremy A Carter (MPD). Direct Examination. Cross-Examination.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Side bar. Jury out of box at 03:27 pm. Discussions held outside the presence of the jury. Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box as 03:35 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by State and Defense. Court instruct the jury. The Court adjourned the trial for the evening and ordered jurors back to count on 06-29-2017 at 09:00 am in Branch 45. Jury out of box at 04:15 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until a  Calendar Call  / Jury Trial scheduled for June 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Anthony P Williams in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court will waive the appearance of the Defendant for purposes of today. Defense requesting an adjournment of Jury Trial scheduled for 03-13-2017 due to a family matter. No objection from State. The Court will grant the request.  Jury Trial scheduled for June 28, 2017 at 09:00 am.  Final Pre-trial scheduled for June 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony P Williams in court with Student Intern Matthew Coker under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Michael Jude.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. In Court discussion put on the record as to jury is at a complete stand still. State requests that Allen Instruction is provided to the Jury. Jury in the box at 1:29 p.m. Court questioned the foreperson in open court, based on the note received from the jury advising that they are at an impasse, Court finds the jury is a mistrial/hung jury. State requests for a new jury trial date GRANTED by the Court.   Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 45.  All parties are notified that effective 8-01-15 this case will be assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
